intro: Masdevallia pelecaniceps, commonly known as the pelecaniceps masdevallia, is a rare and striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its long, pendulous inflorescence and distinctive, showy flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, often found in shaded, humid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
